remarks: Express the Cauchy sequence property in the more conventional three-quantifier form.  (Contributed by NM, 19-Dec-2006.)  (Revised by Mario Carneiro, 14-Nov-2013.)
statement:
iscau3.2 $e |- Z = ( ZZ>= ` M ) $.
iscau3.3 $e |- ( ph -> D e. ( *Met ` X ) ) $.
iscau3.4 $e |- ( ph -> M e. ZZ ) $.
iscau3 $p |- ( ph -> ( F e. ( Cau ` D ) <-> ( F e. ( X ^pm CC ) /\ A. x e. RR+ E. j e. Z A. k e. ( ZZ>= ` j ) ( k e. dom F /\ ( F ` k ) e. X /\ A. m e. ( ZZ>= ` k ) ( ( F ` k ) D ( F ` m ) ) < x ) ) ) ) $.
$d D j k m x $.
$d F j k m x $.
$d M j $.
$d X j k m x $.
$d Z j k x $.
$d j k ph x $.
